uniol.apt.pnanalysis

Class PnAnalysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.pnanalysis.PnAnalysis

  • public class PnAnalysis
extends java.lang.Object
    Checks for a given Petri net depending on g and k, if there is a T-system, whose reachability graph is isomorph to the reachability graph of the given Petri net. Therefore the Petri net has to fulfill some preconditions: - is plain - the initial marking is a k-marking with k >= 2 - is bounded - is reversible - is persistent - all smallest cycles the same parikh vector
    Author:
    Raffaela Ferrari, Bj√∂rn von der Linde

      For a given transitions-system t1 and a T-System tSystem, labels in tSystem will be adjusted, so that a found weak isomorphism (isomorphism that ignores labels) between both systems may be a strong isomorphism (isomorphism, that doesn't ignore labels)

    • Method Detail

      • checkAllIsomorphicTSystemsForPetriNet

        public PetriNet checkAllIsomorphicTSystemsForPetriNet(PetriNet pn,
                                                      java.lang.Integer g,
                                                      java.lang.Integer k,
                                                      boolean randomly)
                                               throws PreconditionFailedException
        Checks for a given Petri net depending on g and k, if there is a T-system, whose reachability graph is isomorph to the reachability graph of the given Petri net.
        Parameters:
        pn - the given Petri net, for which the check has to be performed.
        g - maximum number of places, for which T-systems should be tested.
        k - maximum number of tokens, for which T-systems should be tested. If k is null, the standard value is 10 for T-system, which aren't cycles, and for cycles all numbers of tokens will be tested at the standard
        randomly - if true, only one randomly selected T-system is checked, otherwise all T-systems are checked
        Returns:
        null, if no T-systems are found, otherwise the first found T-system, whose reachability graph is isomorph to the reachability graph of the given Petri net
        Throws:
        PreconditionFailedException - is thrown, if the given Petri net breaks one of the preconditions.

      • isIsomorphic

        private boolean isIsomorphic(TransitionSystem t1,
                             PetriNet tSystem)
                      throws UnboundedException
        Check if the reachability graph of the given Petri net is isomorph to the reachability graph of a T-system.
        Parameters:
        t1 - the reachability graph of the given Petri net
        tSystem - the T-system, for which the reachability graph is checked for isomorphie
        Returns:
        true, if the reachability graphs are isomorph, otherwise false
        Throws:
        UnboundedException - is thrown, if the T-system is unbounded.

      • adjustLabels

        private boolean adjustLabels(TransitionSystem t1,
                             TransitionSystem t2,
                             PetriNet tSystem,
                             java.util.Deque<IsomorphismLogic.ExtendedState> isomorphicPairs)
        For a given transitions-system t1 and a T-System tSystem, labels in tSystem will be adjusted, so that a found weak isomorphism (isomorphism that ignores labels) between both systems may be a strong isomorphism (isomorphism, that doesn't ignore labels)
        Parameters:
        t1 - Reachability-Graph of given pn
        t2 - Reachability-Graph of given T-System
        tSystem - T-System to be checked if isomorphic
        isomorphicPairs - State with isomorphic pairs of nodes, that were found for weak isomorphism ("weak": labels are ignored)
        Returns:
        true if t1 and tSystem are strong isomorphic ("strong": labels are not ignored)

      • getNextIsomorphicPairs

        private java.util.List<IsomorphismLogic.ExtendedState> getNextIsomorphicPairs(java.util.Deque<IsomorphismLogic.ExtendedState> isomorphicPairs,
                                                                              IsomorphismLogic.ExtendedState exState,
                                                                              TransitionSystem t1,
                                                                              TransitionSystem t2)
        This function determines all postset isomorphic ExtendedStates of the given ExtendedState. Therefore it shows, if there is a isomorphic ExtendedState in isomorphicPairs, in which n is a state of the postset states of the first state and m is a state of the postset states of the second state of the given ExtendedState. If true, then it will be added to the List.
        Parameters:
        isomorphicPairs - State with isomorphic pairs of nodes, that were found for weak isomorphism ("weak": labels are ignored)
        exState - ExtendedState, for which postset isomorphic ExtendedState should be found
        t1 - Reachability-Graph of given pn
        t2 - Reachability-Graph of given t-system
        Returns:
        a List of ExtendedStates
